subject: CGSC
name: Cognitive Psychology
info: This course provides a comprehensive introduction to the major tools, assumptions, and theories of cognitive psychology, exploring the nature of thought processes such as attention, memory, concept, reasoning, perception, emotion, and language. This course lays a foundation for understanding how the mind works and how the brain produces such a mind.

subject: CGSC
name: Curr Practical Training
info: Professional employment assignment in which cognitive science expertise is both required and further developed.  Grades are based on a written report about the work assignment.

subject: CGSC
name: Sem:Phil of Cog Sci
fullname: Seminar: Philosophy of the Cognitive Sciences
info: Philosophical framework for analyzing cognitive sciences. Recent developments in metaphysics and epistemology. Nature of scientific theories, methodologies of cognitive sciences, relations among cognitive sciences, relation of cognitive science to epistemology, and various philosophical problems.prereq: Grad cog sci minor or instr consent

subject: CGSC
name: Prosem
info: Survey of major topics, including theoretical assumptions, methods, and samples of current research.prereq: Grad cog sci minor or instr consent

subject: CGSC
name: Cognitive Neuroscience
info: Relations between brain activity and cognitive function in mammals. Working memory, attention, decision processing, executive function, categorization, planning, sequence processing. Behavioral/physiological perspectives. Disruption of cognitive function following brain damage. Extracellular recording of single neuron activity in nonhuman primates. Functional neuroimaging/magnetoencephalography in humans.prereq: instr consent

subject: CGSC
name: Sem: Topics in Cognitive Sci
info: Lectures and in-depth discussion on a topic.

subject: CGSC
name: Perspectives in Cognition
fullname: Perspectives in Learning, Perception, and Cognition
info: Lectures/discussions in cognitive sciences by local/visiting faculty.

subject: CGSC
name: FTE: Doctoral
info: tbdprereq: Doctoral student, adviser consent, DGS consent

subject: CGSC
name: Doct Pre-Thesis Cr*
info: tbdprereq: Doctoral student who has not passed prelim oral; no required consent for 1st/2nd registrations, up to 12 combined cr; dept consent for 3rd/4th registrations, up to 24 combined cr; doctoral student admitted before summer 2007 may register up to four times, up to 60 combined cr

subject: CGSC
name: Thesis Credit: Masters
info: (No description)prereq: Max 18 cr per semester or summer; 10 cr total required [Plan A only] max crs 50; 10 completions allowed

subject: CGSC
name: Thesis Credit: Doct*
info: (No description)prereq: Max 18 cr per semester or summer, 24 cr required
